statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Arkansas 68, Oral Roberts 56
article.story: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. (AP) -- Arkansas' Patrick Beverley didn't start Friday's game against Oral Roberts because he made a freshman-like mistake by being late to his team's pregame meal. He made up for it with a senior-like performance. Beverley scored 25 points and the Razorbacks gave coach Stan Heath his 100th career victory in a 68-56 triumph. Beverley was 13-of-15 from the free-throw line in the second half, but also came up with big shots for Arkansas (9-3) down the stretch to help keep the Golden Eagles (5-6) from getting close. "I made a ... mistake tonight, so I felt like I really had to prove myself," Beverley said. "I wanted to play hard and get the job done. We really came out in the second half strong and finished well." Arkansas' offense couldn't find a good rhythm in the first half, hitting only 37 percent of its shots from the floor. Meanwhile, the Golden Eagles took advantage of seven first-half turnovers by the Razorbacks and led by as many as 5 points with 8:33 left before intermission. Arkansas also benefited from the post play of Charles Thomas, who finished with 12 points, and Sonny Weems, with 18. Thomas also grabbed 9 rebounds. The Golden Eagles were paced mostly by forward Caleb Green, who scored 23 points and pulled down 15 of his team's 36 rebounds. Ken Tutt was ORU's only other player scoring in double figures, with 15 points. The Razorbacks outscored ORU 32-14 in the paint and also got 45 of their points from the bench. Arkansas trailed ORU 26-24 at the half, but after taking the lead early in the second half, put together two stretches that kept the Golden Eagles from getting in front again. The Razorbacks opened the half with a 10-4 run -- including two dunks by Weems and one by 7-footer Steven Hill -- and never looked back. Beverley also hit five straight free throws in the last minute of the game when he was fouled while shooting a 3-pointer by ORU's Yemi Ogunoye and the ORU bench was tagged with a technical foul. "They had a lot more energy," Oral Roberts coach Scott Sutton said. "Arkansas likes to get the ball out of transition. We had way too many turnovers. It's hard to win games (on the road) against good teams."
